title: Former Jets star center Mangold dies at age 41
content: Former New York Jets center Nick Mangold has died due to complications from kidney disease. He was 41.

title: Browns' Sanders inactive; Zappe QB2 vs. Pats
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders is inactive for Sunday's game against the Patriots because of a back injury.

title: 8-0 Aggies empty Tiger Stadium with rout of LSU
content: Texas A&M coach Mike Elko said he isn't worried about the program's decades of underachievement and is focused on the 2025 Aggies, who are 8-0 after beating LSU 49-25 on Saturday.

title: Sources: Manning concussed in Texas' OT win
content: Backup Matthew Caldwell threw a scoring pass to Emmett Mosley V in OT after starter Arch Manning was knocked out of the game with an injury, and No. 22 Texas came back to defeat Mississippi State 45-38 on Saturday, improving to 6-2 (3-1 in the SEC).

title: NCAA ordered to pay $18M in concussion lawsuit
content: A former S.C. State football player and his wife were awarded $18 million after a jury found the NCAA negligent of failing to warn about long-term concussion effects.

title: Jays' Scherzer to start Game 3 vs. LA's Glasnow
content: Max Scherzer will start Game 3 of the World Series for the Blue Jays, while the Dodgers will give the ball to Tyler Glasnow.

title: Sources: Titans open to deal, won't trade stars
content: The Titans are open to dealing ahead of the NFL trade deadline, but are unwilling to part with Cam Ward or Jeffery Simmons, sources told ESPN.

title: üòè Ole Miss' jab at Oklahoma leads Week 9 trolls
content: The Rebels boosted their College Football Playoff hopes in a major way with a big win in Norman, Oklahoma.

title: Week 8 inactives: With injuries and 'bye-mageddon,' who can you start this week?
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Takeaways from Dodgers' series-tying win over Blue Jays
content: After Toronto rolled in the opener, Los Angeles rebounded to even the Fall Classic. Here's how it went down.

title: What's next: Rebook Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane immediately
content: UFC 321 ended in disaster, but it is pretty clear what the next step is for the heavyweight division.

title: X-ray tables, marked cards and the Mafia: How the FBI says poker games were rigged
content: Details of how poker games, some involving Chauncey Billups, were allegedly rigged to make people lose big.

title: Lando Norris gets dream Mexico pole: Max P5, Piastri P8
content: Lando Norris gave a significant boost to his championship chances by taking pole position for the Mexican Grand Prix while his title rivals qualified in fifth and eighth, respectively.

title: VAR review: Should Man United have had a penalty vs. Brighton?
content: Amad Diallo ran into the Brighton area, drawing Maxim De Cuyper into making a challenge. But was it a penalty?

title: Stoppage-time goals in the Premier League are out of control
content: The EPL is renowned for delivering late drama, but stoppage-time goals have reached a whole new level.

title: Thamel: Five questions that will define a wild CFB coaching carousel
content: Big-money buyouts, big-name candidates and more coaches under pressure. Let's break down college football's biggest coaching questions.

title: WWE 'SmackDown' highlights: McIntyre heats up title match against Rhodes
content: Friday's "SmackDown" set up a perfect "Saturday Night's Main Event," with Drew McIntyre and Cody Rhodes ready for the challenge.

title: NFC East roundtable: Can the defending champs take the division crown again?
content: So far, every team in the NFC East except the Eagles has played three division games. Here's how they stack up.

title: Giants-Eagles rivalry and the punt that lives in NFL infamy
content: DeSean Jackson and Matt Dodge relive a 15-year-old shank and a walk-off return that fans will never forget.

title: NBA intel: Wemby's new game plan, and early concerns for Lakers and Rockets
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst take the pulse of the league after a thrilling first few nights of 2025-26.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

title: NFL Week 8's fashionable arrivals, featuring Mack Hollins' Halloween costume
content: From suits to streetwear, Week 8's arrivals mixed personal flair and cold. weather layers with comfort and creativity.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Greenwood-Rashford reunion
content: Barcelona scouts are keeping tabs on Marseille striker Mason Greenwood. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Where First Ladies Made History: Legacy Of White House East Wing Trump Razed
content: Betty Ford reportedly said that if the White House West Wing is the "mind" of the nation, then the East Wing - the traditional power centre for first ladies - is the "heart."

title: Rajasthan Officer's Wife Earns Rs 37.54 Lakh 'Salary' From 2 Firms Without Working
content: In nearly two years, she never went to either office yet earned Rs 37.54 lakh in 'salary' as an alleged employee of the companies.

title: Top US Official Signals Last-Minute Deal With China Ahead Of Trump-Xi Meet
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Sunday signalled a deal with China to avoid escalating a tariff-fueled trade war, just days before a summit between Presidents Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

title: Prince Andrew May Be Kicked Out Of UK Royal Palace. Here's Why
content: Britain's scandal-tarred Prince Andrew faced continued scrutiny Sunday of his contentious living arrangements and titles, amid reports of talks with King Charles III about vacating his 30-room royal residence.

title: "US Seeks Closer Ties With Pak, But Not At India's Expense": Marco Rubio
content: The US sees an opportunity to expand its strategic relationship with Pakistan but it will not be at the expense of its historic and important ties with India, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has said.

title: Indian Man Carves World's Smallest Spoon: You'll Need a Microscope To See It
content: A 23-year-old miniature artist from Odisha's Ganjam district has set a new Guinness World Record for crafting the smallest wooden spoon.

title: "Lesson For Them": Madhya Pradesh Minister's Shocker On Australian Cricketers' Molestation
content: Even as India hosts the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025, a shocking crime in Indore has overshadowed the tournament's spirit.

title: Nepal PM Expands Cabinet, Appoints Two Youth Icons As Ministers
content: Nepal's Prime Minister Sushila Karki expanded on Sunday her interim cabinet, which was formed in the wake of a youth-led uprising last month, inducting two ministers seen as popular among young people.

title: Nitish Kumar Visits Chirag Paswan's Home For Chhath Puja Ritual
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Sunday drove down to the residence of Union minister Chirag Paswan to partake 'kharna prasad", which devotees consume before embarking on a gruelling 36-hour-long fast as part of Chhath Puja.

title: Rahul Gandhi, Sonia Gandhi Among 40 Star Campaigners For Bihar Elections
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge and senior leaders Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Kanhaiya Kumar and Independent MP Pappu Yadav are among the party's 40 star campaigners for the first phase of the Bihar assembly polls.

title: The Washington Post Can Question, But India Knows LIC Delivers
content: If there is one institution that commands unshakable faith across India, it is the Life Insurance Corporation or LIC. More than an insurer, it is a symbol of trust woven into India's social and economic fabric.

title: Another Hit Job Falls Flat: Washington Post's Credibility Crisis in India
content: Once celebrated as a global symbol of fearless journalism, the Washington Post today faces serious questions about its credibility in India.

title: 20-Year-Old Woman Suffers Burn Injuries In Acid Attack In Delhi
content: A 20-year-old woman sustained burn injuries on her hands in an alleged acid attack by her stalker and his associates near Laxmi Bai College in northwest Delhi's Ashok Vihar area on Sunday, an official said.

title: If INDIA Bloc Wins Bihar, Waqf Act Will Be "Thrown Into Dustbin: Tejashwi Yadav
content: If the INDIA bloc is voted to power in Bihar, the Waqf (Amendment) Act would be "thrown into the dustbin", the opposition coalition's Chief Minister candidate Tejashwi Yadav said on Sunday.

title: BJP vs Opposition Over Ex-MP's Mention In Maharashtra Doctor's Suicide Note
content: The death by suicide of a woman doctor in Satara district has set off a political uproar in Maharashtra, with the opposition demanding a high-level probe and accusing the state government of shielding influential figures.

title: Rajasthan School Principal Suspended For Checking Girl's WhatsApp, Gallery
content: The acting principal of a government senior secondary school here was suspended on Saturday for checking the mobile phone of a female student, officials said.

title: 22-Year-Old Law Student's Stomach Split Open, Fingers Cut In Kanpur: Cops
content: A 22-year-old law student's stomach was split open, his fingers cut after an argument with a medical shop operator in Kanpur, police said.

title: Lithuania Has A 'Cigarette-Smuggling Balloon' Problem With Belarus
content: Flights at Lithuania's main airport were disrupted on two successive nights in the latest of a string of incidents involving suspected sightings of balloons used to smuggle cigarettes from neighbouring Belarus.

title: Ahead Of Bihar Elections, Nitish Kumar's JDU Expels 16 Leaders For Anti-Party Activities
content: Cracking down on rebellion in the party ahead of assembly elections, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's JD(U) expelled 16 leaders, including a sitting MLA and two former ministers, most of whom have entered the fray against official NDA candidates

title: Poll Body Set For Nationwide Roll Revision? Sources Say 10 States In Phase 1
content: The date for nationwide rollout of Special Intensive Revision of voter rolls is expected to be announced tomorrow by the Election Commission.

title: Flying into the US? You will be photographed; entered into facial recognition database
content: US Customs and Border Protection will expand its biometric tracking, photographing nearly all non-US citizens entering or departing the country. This new rule, effective soon, aims to enhance national security and combat fraudulent travel by creating a comprehensive facial-recognition database.  It eliminates previous age exemptions and applies to all non-citizens, including lawful permanent residents.

title: '5 soldiers, 25 militants killed': Pak reports fresh border clashes with Afghanistan
content: Pakistan reported five soldiers and 25 militants killed in border clashes with Afghanistan, despite ongoing peace talks in Istanbul. The military questioned the timing of these attacks, suggesting doubts about the interim Afghan government's commitment to curbing terrorism. Islamabad has urged Kabul to manage its borders effectively and prevent Afghan soil from being used against Pakistan.

title: GM layoffs: Engineers fired on Microsoft Teams; Says it's business, not you
content: General Motors has let go of over 200 salaried employees, mainly CAD engineers, at its Michigan tech campus. This move, part of a restructuring to boost profits, follows strong third-quarter earnings and a raised financial outlook. GM stated the layoffs target execution roles to enhance core design capabilities. This comes as the automotive sector sees broader workforce reductions.

title: ‚ÄòRape charges, marriage proposal‚Äô: Fresh revelations in Maha doctor suicide; probe takes a twist
content: A 28-year-old doctor's suicide in Satara has taken a disturbing turn with allegations of rape by a police sub-inspector and a techie.  The deceased, from Beed, left a note on her palm implicating the sub-inspector and another individual for five months of torment. Authorities have apprehended both accused in connection with the alleged rape and abetment of suicide.

title: ‚ÄòDrunk drivers are terrorists‚Äô: Hyderabad top cop on Kurnool bus fire
content: Hyderabad Police Commissioner VC Sajjanar declared drunk drivers as terrorists following a tragic bus fire that killed 20 people in Kurnool. He emphasized that the incident, caused by an intoxicated biker, was a preventable massacre, not an accident. Sajjanar vowed a zero-tolerance approach to drunk driving in Hyderabad, stating such acts will be punished as crimes.

title: Ex-Google CEO‚Äôs advice to engineers: Work hard during week, but turn off phone on weekend
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt advises young engineers and junior staff to disconnect from screens on weekends. He suggests dedicating a few hours to reflect on the past week and plan for the next using pen and paper. This practice, he explains, fosters accountability and clarity, leading to greater effectiveness.

title: Former Jets star Nick Mangold dies at 41 after kidney battle, leaving lasting legacy
content: Former New York Jets center Nick Mangold has died at age 41 due to complications from kidney disease. The respected leader and cornerstone of the Jets' offensive line for over a decade had recently revealed he was undergoing dialysis and seeking a transplant donor. Mangold's toughness, loyalty, and leadership defined an era for the franchise.

title: Delhi horror: 'Stalker' throws acid at 20-year-old student; probe launched
content: A 20-year-old woman from Mukundpur, Delhi, was injured in an acid attack by three men, including acquaintance Jitender, following a month-old argument. She sustained burns on both hands and is admitted to Deep Chand Bandhu Hospital. Police have registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), and the Crime and FSL teams are investigating the incident.

title: Women lead full-time MBA applications: Growth seen worldwide; flexible programmes rise
content: Women have surpassed men in applications to full-time MBA programmes worldwide, according to the GMAC 2025 Application Trends Survey. Full-time, two-year MBA programmes saw 63% of schools reporting growth in female applicants, while online and flex MBA programmes also experienced increases. Women make up roughly 41% of full-time MBA applicants and dominate Master of Marketing and Accounting applications. Executive MBA and Master of Finance programmes remain male-dominated. Flexible and online formats continue to attract higher female representation globally.

title: GitHub is in trouble from AI; Gates complained, Nadella agrees
content: Microsoft is revamping GitHub to tackle AI coding rivals like Cursor and Claude Code. CEO Satya Nadella highlighted the need to unify development tools, drawing parallels to Bill Gates' past vision.  The platform aims to integrate AI across all developer workflows, ensuring choice in models and surfaces to regain developer mindshare.

title: Explained: Why Canada's visa system is facing a meltdown
content: Canada's immigration system is facing unprecedented challenges as visa rejections surge across visitor, study, and work categories in 2025. This sharp decline, impacting hundreds of thousands of potential arrivals, is attributed to the increased use of automated decision-making tools like Chinook, leading to generic refusal letters and concerns about fairness and transparency.

title: US-China trade talks: 'Substantial framework' reached ahead of Trump-Xi meet
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced a substantial framework to prevent 100% tariffs on Chinese goods and defer rare earths export controls. High-level talks in Kuala Lumpur preceded this development, aiming for more balanced trade, agricultural purchases, and fentanyl crisis measures. The framework is expected to be finalized by Presidents Trump and Xi.

title: Injury scare for India! Pratika Rawal hobbles off with ankle twist - Watch
content: India's World Cup campaign faced a significant setback as opener Pratika Rawal sustained a twisted ankle during the match against Bangladesh.  The in-form batter hobbled off, raising concerns about her availability for the crucial semifinal against Australia.  Rawal's absence would be a major blow, given her stellar performances, including a recent century.

title: Explained: TN Private Universities Amendment Bill; reasons behind the backlash
content: The Tamil Nadu Private Universities (Amendment) Bill 2025 has sparked backlash from universities, students, and stakeholders due to changes in approvals, governance, and compliance. Key concerns include retroactive validation of past notifications, stricter oversight, alignment of medical courses with NMC standards, and rigid requirements for sponsoring bodies. Following widespread objections, the Education Minister announced a review of the Bill. The government aims to balance regulatory clarity with operational flexibility while ensuring legal and national compliance for private universities.

title: Nick Mangold reveals chronic kidney disease, begins urgent search for donor
content: Former New York Jets star Nick Mangold, a seven-time Pro Bowler, is bravely battling chronic kidney disease. Diagnosed with a genetic defect in 2006, the 41-year-old is now undergoing dialysis and urgently seeking a type O kidney donor.  Mangold expressed gratitude for the overwhelming support from fans and the football community as he faces this significant health challenge.

title: 'Birth-based ruling class': Dynasts lead candidate lists in Bihar polls
content: In a region where political awareness runs deep despite limited economic and educational progress, dynastic influence remains an unbroken thread. As Bihar heads into assembly elections, the hold of family-based politics spans parties and ideologies alike ‚Äî from the RJD to the BJP ‚Äî reflecting how lineage continues to shape leadership in one of India‚Äôs most politically conscious states.

title: 'Fantastic effort' - Rohit lauds young India pacer despite ODI series defeat
content: Rohit Sharma's unbeaten 121 powered India to a nine-wicket win against Australia in the third ODI, though the series was lost 1-2.  Sharma lauded young Harshit Rana's performance and reflected on the tough Australian opposition. He detailed his strategic approach to the innings and praised his partnership with Virat Kohli, highlighting their mutual understanding and experience.

title: Not done yet: 'Ro-Ko' turn back the clock, script their own ending Down Under
content: On a golden Sydney evening, two men who have defined Indian cricket for over a decade found themselves writing the perfect epilogue. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma ‚Äî both long retired from Tests and T20Is ‚Äî walked out one last time in blue on Australian soil. The result wasn‚Äôt just a win; it was a resurrection ‚Äî a poetic reminder that their story, even now, isn‚Äôt done.

title: Pan-India SIR: EC to hold presser on Monday evening; may appoint volunteers for Bengal
content: The Election Commission of India will announce a pan-India Special Intensive Revision of voters' lists on October 27. This exercise, expected to cover 10-15 states including those with 2026 Assembly elections, may involve volunteers assisting Booth Level Officers in West Bengal. The revision could lead to an increase of approximately 14,000 polling booths in the state.

title: 'One last time‚Ä¶ signing off' - Rohit drops bombshell on social media
content: Rohit Sharma's cryptic social media post after the ODI series against Australia has sparked speculation about his future. Despite India's loss, Sharma's unbeaten 121 in the final match, his 50th international century, showcased his enduring class. He expressed his love for playing in Australia and the importance of mentoring younger players.

title: Katy Perry & Justin Trudeau confirm romance, make first public appearance in Paris
content: Pop star Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau have confirmed their relationship. The couple made their first public appearance hand-in-hand in Paris. They were seen exiting a cabaret show after celebrating Perry's birthday. Paparazzi and fans captured their affectionate moments. This outing follows earlier sightings of the couple together.

title: Explained: How Mark Carney is trying to reassure Canadians after Trump‚Äôs tariff threats
content: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney is projecting calm after US President Donald Trump imposed a 10% tariff hike on Canadian imports, triggered by a provincial ad.  Carney aims to reassure Canadians and signal to the US that Ottawa won't be bullied, while emphasizing trade diversification towards Asia and preparing for a new budget.

title: Doug Martin‚Äôs family speaks out after his mysterious death in police custody
content: Former NFL star Doug Martin, 36, has died in police custody following a reported break-in.  Officers attempted to detain him, leading to a struggle and his subsequent unresponsiveness.  His family revealed he battled mental illness, with a recent incident involving a jump from a rehab window.  Authorities are investigating the cause of his death.

title: 6 years after receiving arrears, retired employees told to repay - until this SC ruling
content: The Supreme Court has ruled in favor of five retired Odisha judiciary employees, quashing a demand to repay salary arrears received six years prior. The apex court stated that surplus payments cannot be reclaimed from employees if they were not involved in fraud or misrepresentation, emphasizing equity and preventing undue hardship.

title: Explained: Why PM's Bihar campaign start is a calculated political move
content: Prime Minister Modi launched the NDA's Bihar campaign in Mithilanchal, strategically invoking Karpoori Thakur's legacy to appeal to the Extremely Backward Classes (EBCs). This region, with its significant electoral weight and volatile voting patterns, is crucial for the NDA's path to power. Development projects and cultural pride are also key elements of their outreach.

title: Satish Shah‚Äôs final moments: ‚ÄòEk niwala khaye, phir collapse ...‚Äô
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah, 74, passed away on October 25 due to kidney failure, leaving fans and colleagues in mourning. His manager revealed he collapsed during his last meal. Shah had undergone a kidney transplant a few months prior but had appeared to be recovering.

title: Victoria Beckham breaks silence on marriage struggles amid David‚Äôs 2004 affair claims
content: Victoria Beckham revealed on a podcast how she and David have navigated decades of rumors, including the 2004 nanny affair claims. She stated these challenges have strengthened their 26-year marriage, emphasizing their resilience as a couple and family.  Despite past difficulties, they remain united, prioritizing each other and their children.

title: Skidded bike, panicked driver: How events unfolded in Kurnool bus fire
content: A tragic bus accident near Kurnool claimed 19 lives after a bus collided with a motorcycle. The pillion rider recounted how the bike skidded, leading to the fatal crash. The bus driver stated he was driving at 80-90 kmph and couldn't avoid the bike, later attempting to rescue passengers.

title: Asean Summit: 'Not just trade but cultural partners,' says PM Modi - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted ASEAN's significance as a "main pillar" of India's Act East Policy during the 47th ASEAN Summit. He emphasized shared geography, culture, and values, stating India and ASEAN are not just trade but also cultural partners.

title: Emiru‚ÄìMizkif controversy: Breakup sparks assault and legal claims
content: Twitch streamer Emiru publicly accused ex-boyfriend Mizkif of sexual assault, emotional abuse, stalking, and blackmail threats. She detailed disturbing past threats and a new warning sign at TwitchCon 2025, prompting her to speak out for her safety. Mizkif admitted to toxic fights but denied assault, while Emiru is pursuing restraining orders.

title: Coldplay frontman Chris Martin dating Sophie Turner after split from Dakota Johnson: Reports
content: Reports suggest a new romance between 'Game of Thrones' star Sophie Turner and Coldplay's Chris Martin, following their recent breakups. The duo was reportedly spotted on a secret London date. Turner, a known Coldplay fan, and Martin, currently in London for tour dates, are said to have connected after their respective splits. Neither has confirmed the burgeoning dating rumors.

title: Hailee Steinfeld reveals 11pm emergency therapy call while Josh Allen faces Bills' slump
content: Actress Hailee Steinfeld candidly shared her struggles with career and relationship pressures, detailing a late-night therapy session prompted by doubts about balancing ambitions. Her personal newsletter, Beau Society, now on Substack, offers fans intimate insights. Meanwhile, her husband, NFL star Josh Allen, aims to lead the Buffalo Bills back to winning ways amidst their own public scrutiny.

title: Joe Burrow injury update: Will Bengals star return in Week 8 vs Jets?
content: Joe Burrow's recovery from turf toe surgery is raising long-term concerns for the Cincinnati Bengals, with his return timeline uncertain. Experts suggest that adopting a Tom Brady-like approach to nutrition and flexibility could be crucial for Burrow's durability and preventing future injuries. The Bengals face a challenging season ahead as they await their franchise quarterback's return.

title: India under Gambhir - What's the success rate with and without Virat & Rohit?
content: Gautam Gambhir's coaching tenure has seen India achieve a 67.9% win rate across 53 matches. While the team performs at 50% with veterans Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, a young brigade has secured an impressive 83% win rate in their absence, showcasing a strong transition under the new coach's leadership.

title: Satish Shah funeral: Rupali Ganguly, Ratna Pathak & more pay tribute
content: The Indian entertainment industry mourns the sudden passing of veteran actor Satish Shah, aged 74, due to kidney failure. Known for his iconic role in 'Sarabhai vs Sarabhai' and numerous films, Shah's demise has left colleagues and fans deeply saddened. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Anupam Kher were among those who paid heartfelt tributes to the beloved actor.

title: Did Trump hit bull‚Äôs eye with tariffs? Why India, China may stop buying Russian oil ‚Äî explained
content: US President Donald Trump's sanctions on Russia's Rosneft and Lukoil may compel India and China to halt crude imports. While tariffs proved insufficient, these sanctions block financial transactions, making trade nearly impossible.

title: Satish Shah‚Äôs funeral: Sarabhai vs Sarabhai cast bids emotional goodbye; sings iconic title track
content: Veteran actor Satish Shah passed away at 74. The cast of Sarabhai vs Sarabhai gathered for an emotional farewell. Rupali Ganguly, Sumeet Raghavan, and others sang the show's title track. They remembered Shah as a father figure. JD Majethia shared his shock and grief. Shah had recently undergone a kidney transplant.

title: 'Greed for power': Tejashwi counters Chirag Paswan's 'no Muslim CM' charge; questions his 'vision'
content: Tejashwi Yadav accused Chirag Paswan of power greed, claiming he compromised his political stand by joining the ruling alliance. Yadav's remarks followed Paswan's accusation that the RJD opposed a Muslim chief minister in 2005 and continues to do so, urging minority communities to reconsider their loyalty.

title: IND vs AUS: Explosive! Rohit Sharma‚Äôs coach reveals when he plans to retire
content: Rohit Sharma silenced critics with an outstanding ODI series against Australia, scoring 202 runs at an average of 101 and earning Player of the Series. His childhood coach revealed Sharma's ambition to play until the 2027 World Cup, showcasing his enduring self-belief and contribution to the team.

title: Man‚Äôs Rolex seized at airport; HC gives relief‚Äî how customs rules apply to luxury items
content: A Dubai-based Indian traveller successfully challenged Customs at Delhi High Court after his luxury Rolex watch was wrongly classified as commercial goods. The court ruled a single high-value watch isn't automatically for trade, allowing its redemption with a fine. This clarifies that while high-value personal items need declaration, mere possession doesn't imply commercial intent.

title: How the matchups line up for all 46 postseason games
content: all four of those teams are in the mix for the college football Playoff . the five highest-ranked conference champions, plus the next seven highest-rated teams, will make the field . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five most-ranked conferences champions will be awarded first-round byes .

title: A well-done steak for Deion, medium for Dabo: How CFB chefs please everyone's palates
content: in 2019, he was the executive chef of the Seattle Seahawks . he had applied for a culinary position with LSU before where he would be working at Tiger Stadium . in his interview, he cooked for 35 people -- executives, dieticians and other high-ranking officials .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 9: Vandy's in the field!
content: Vanderbilt Commodores is on the brink of making its first appearance in any CFP ranking during the playoff era . if the playoff were today, they would already be in the top 12 when the first ranking is released Nov. 4 . there's a chance to make their debut in the coveted top 12 .

title: Deion 'dumbfounded' by Buffs' historic Utah loss
content: deion Sanders: "this is probably the worst beating I've ever had except when my momma whooped me as a kid" the 49-point margin was the largest in the 72-game history of the "Rumble in the Rockies" rivalry between Colorado and Utah .

title: NHL Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus small-sample superstars
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . this week's new edition of the ESPN NHL Power Rankings, we've identified a player on each team who has excelled way beyond expectations thus far .

title: Who said what? Take our college football Week 9 quotes quiz
content: Lane Kiffin starts his interview by quipping with an Oklahoma defender who said Ole Miss wouldn't score on them. (0:40) Week 9 of college football's 2025 regular season was exciting. A number of Top 25 teams won games that were decided by a single score. Just to name a few: No. 4  Alabama  eked out a  29-22 win  over  South Carolina , No. 8  Ole Miss  outlasted No. 13  Oklahoma   34-28 , No. 10  Vanderbilt  beat No. 17  Missouri   17-10 , No. 16  Virginia  beat Bill Belichick's  North Carolina   17-16 , and No. 22  Texas  needed overtime to beat  Mississippi State   45-38 . Saturday produced some great quotes from college football coaches. Can you guess who said what?

title: Rethinking Indiana, Vanderbilt and Virginia's place in the CFB hierarchy after Week 9
content: it's human nature to assume that every trend line points endlessly in the same direction, off to some far horizon . we hear "Texas is back" each season, and we're secure in the knowledge that sooner or later, we all get to laugh about it again . despite the endless universe, there are some hard truths that are impossible to escape .

title: How Giannis and the Bucks managed an awkward offseason
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo appeared on a projector screen in the interview room . it was the first day a team could officially gather before the start of training camp . he had come down with COVID the week before and had not been cleared to travel .

title: Wetzel: As bad as this is, the next betting scandal is coming
content: almost every sports league, team and operation wants in on sports wagering revenue . sponsorships, partnerships. advertising. maybe it's direct payments . sports is awash in gambling cash . more than 30 people were arrested, including big shots .

title: Plantation Corporation of Kerala launches  project to identify sustainable cashew farming model
content: The project tests three distinct farming models to determine the most productive and profitable approach for small and marginal farmers across south India

title: Buffalo breeding to get a boost, courtesy new yolk-free technology
content: A ready-to-use, egg yolk-free solution ‚Äì CRYODIL ‚Äì can preserve buffalo semen for up to 18 months; this is said to be the first time such a product has been developed and tested in India

title: Inform before going out, Madhya Pradesh Minister tells cricketers after Indore incident
content: ‚ÄòPlayers sometimes don‚Äôt realise their fame but they are very popular. They should also be careful,‚Äô Kailash Vijayvargiya said, days after two Australian women players were allegedly stalked and molested in Indore

title: ISRO to launch military communications satellite CMS-03 on November 2
content: Also known as GSAT-7R, it is a ‚Äòmulti-band communication satellite that will provide services over a wide oceanic region including the Indian landmass‚Äô, ISRO said

title: Vijay‚Äôs TVK may revise campaign strategy as it resumes activities after a nearly month-long break
content: Sources say they expect party activities to gain momentum after their founder‚Äôs meeting with the families of the Karur stampede victims in Mamallapuram on October 27

title: CBI takes over the investigation in the Karur stampede case
content: A special¬†CBI¬†team has been pressed into action to gather evidence, according to agency sources. The CBI re-registered the case on the directions of the Supreme Court on October 13

title: Homebuyers‚Äô body FPCE wants changes in RERA law, pitches for rules to verify promoters‚Äô track record
content: Forum For People's Collective Efforts president Abhay Upadhyay has written to Union Minister of Housing and Urban Affairs Manohar Lal, seeking more teeth to regulators established under the law for protecting the interests of consumers

title: Bengaluru engineer finds mention in PM Modi‚Äôs ‚ÄòMann ki baat‚Äô for lake rejuvenation
content: Sharma, who moved to Bengaluru from Raipur in 2001 to pursue engineering, says he fell in love with the city‚Äôs tree-lined streets

title: CPI(ML) manifesto promises land justice, 65% reservation for disadvantaged in Bihar
content: CPI(ML) promised government procurement of all crops and guarantee of fair prices, loan waiver for farmers and rural labourers, free electricity for agriculture, guarantee of rights and ban on eviction of sharecroppers, and restoration of Agricultural Produce Market Committee Act.

title: 20-minute daily walk vs Rs 10 lakh home gym: What really keeps your heart healthy
content: The TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. At the TOI Lifestyle Desk, we go beyond the obvious, delving into the extraordinary. Consider us your lifestyle companion, providing a daily dose of inspiration and information. Whether you're seeking the latest fashion trends, travel escapades, culinary delights, or wellness tips, the TOI Lifestyle Desk is your one-stop destination for an enriching lifestyle experience. title: PM SHRI meant to propagate RSS ideals, says CPI leader and former Minister Sunil Kumar
content: The scheme is part of the National Education Policy 2020 introduced by the Union government, which, Sunil Kumar says, is an attempt to intrude into the federal rights of State governments

title: Social and Educational Survey report for Greater Bengaluru Authority area to include ‚Äòclosed,‚Äô ‚Äòrefused‚Äô households
content: More than 5.79 lakh households recorded as closed, refused, or unsurveyable in the last four days; completion percentage jumps to over 64%

title: Enforcement drive on private buses continues in Andhra Pradesh
content: Transport Department books 361 cases and seizes 40 vehicles in two days with Nandyal district topping in the highest number of violations

title: Bihar Assembly election: In Nalanda, for now it‚Äôs Nitish Kumar
content: Nalanda electorate weighs legacy against change;¬†Nitish‚Äôs untainted persona is hailed; but there are two common complaints ‚Äî the growing dominance of bureaucracy and the JD(U) legislators

title: TNCSC unable to keep pace with arrivals because of labour shortage, says Union
content: Union says serious wage disparities and procedural issues have pushed many experienced hands out of work while farmers are able to complete harvesting and transport the produce within hours

title: Habitat disturbance driving human-animal conflict in Mysuru belt
content: The Sunday‚Äôs tiger attack is the second in recent days and it was less than two weeks ago that another farmer Mahadeva Gowda, lost his vision as his face was mauled in another tiger attack, also in Sargur region

title: Actor Satish Shah cremated; film, TV fraternity pays emotional tributes
content: Shah essayed the role of Indravadhan Sarabhai, the funny and lovable patriarch of the Sarabhai family, who elicited laughs with his witty one-liners on the show ‚ÄòSarabhai vs Sarabhai‚Äô

title: People in Telangana are happy with Congress; BRS no longer on their minds: Mahesh Goud
content: TPCC chief says the party has been rejected by the people for pushing the State into political chaos and financial distress while the ruling Congress remains deeply rooted among citizens and focused on rebuilding Telangana with welfare, transparency and balanced development

title: Central teams assess paddy moisture level in Tiruchi, Pudukkottai, and Thanjavur
content: In these districts, farmers made a common demand: the Centre authorise the State to decide on moisture content relaxation because the delay in the Centre‚Äôs approval affects procurement

title: Vice-Chancellor convenes meeting of Kerala University Syndicate on November 1
content: Various issues, including reinstatement of suspended Registrar K.S. Anil Kumar, are expected to come up for discussion at the meeting to be held after two months

title: Forest officials were coerced into acting in favour of Mohanlal in ivory case, says former Chief Wildlife Warden
content: The department did not probe the route through which the ivory reached the actor, as mandated by the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972, says Surendrakumar. Another official says the government had issued a letter asking the officials not to proceed against the actor

title: Family members of stampede victims leave for Mamallapuram to meet Vijay
content: TVK cadres meet the kin of the victims in their houses and arrange for cars to take them to Vennaimalai from where they were taken to Mamallapuram in AC buses

title: LIC unions reject Washington Post report, call it misleading
content: Unions allege the article seeks to undermine LIC‚Äôs credibility and serve U.S. insurer interests; say Adani Group investment was a Board-approved decision made without external pressure

title: State govt. on a mission to create new Kozhikode, says Minister
content: Event included a video presentation of the achievements of the State government and the Kozhikode Corporation, a report presentation, and the release of the Corpn.‚Äôs progress report

title: With 95,137 applications, liquor shop draw to be held across Telangana on October 27
content: Hyderabad received 3,201 applications for 82 shops and Secunderabad 3,022 for 97 shops while Vikarabad topped the list with 8,536 applications for 100 shops

title: 2025 local body polls: over 29.04 lakh voters in Thiruvananthapuram district
content: The number has increased by 16,828 over the previous revision, held earlier this year, and 77,902 voters compared to the voters‚Äô list used in the 2020 local body elections.

title: Kozhikode to be declared extreme poverty-free district on Oct. 28
content: A survey conducted in 2021-22 under the aegis of various local bodies identified 6,773 families as extremely poor and provided them with assistance including food, health support, employment, and safe accommodation

title: Cyclone Montha: beaches closed, boating suspended in Godavari and Krishna rivers
content: Officials in Eluru, Krishna, and West Godavari districts on high alert as evacuations begin in low-lying coastal villages amid rough sea conditions

title: Nearly 2,000 held in NDPS cases in past 10 months in Kozhikode
content: The police reportedly seized 3,353.5 grams of MDMA and 123.6 kg of ganja, along with substantial quantities of hashish oil, ecstasy pills, and brown sugar

title: Thiruvananthapuram makes a big splash at State School Sports Meet
content: Thiruvananthapuram garners 649 points to finish way ahead of Thrissur (149 points) and Ernakulam (133) in aquatic events of the State School Sports Meet.

title: KTR questions Rahul Gandhi on ‚Äòdeception, minority betrayal and bulldozer governance by Congress‚Äô in Telangana
content: The BRS leader says it is ‚Äúshameful‚Äù that the Congress government is the first in Telangana‚Äôs history to not have a single representative from minority communities

title: Pre-test of Census 2027 to be held in select areas of Ernakulam, Idukki and Palakkad districts in November
content: State government has issued orders appointing Collectors of the three districts as ‚ÄòPrincipal Census Officers‚Äô for the trial run

title: There is no confusion over Yathindra‚Äôs statement, says Satish Jarkiholi
content: It is about ideological succession and taking the AHINDA movement forward, according to the Minister

title: Cyclone: YSRCP chief Jagan urges people to be alert
content: YSRCP postpones its protest rallies against ‚Äòprivatisation‚Äô of medical colleges slated for October 28 to November 4

title: Medical college doctors in Kerala to boycott outpatient clinics on October 28
content: Kerala Government Medical College Teachers Association calls for boycott accusing State government of failing to respond to their various demands

title: Bihar: INDIA bloc ally says won't implement Waqf Act if voted to power

title: Ties with Pak not at India's expense, says Marco Rubio -- even though it is
content: ties with india will not be at the expense of Washington's "deep, historic, and important" ties, he says . new Delhi has not directly communicated any unease to the US on the matter . the u.s. secretary of state says he doesn't think anything we're doing with Pakistan comes at the cost of our relationship or friendship with India .
